pull.title: test: use MiniWallet for mempool_package_onemore.py
pull.body: This PR enables one more of the non-wallet functional tests (mempool_package_onemore.py) to be run even with the Bitcoin Core wallet disabled by using the MiniWallet instead, as proposed in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/20078. For this purpose helper methods `MiniWallet.{create,send}_self_transfer_multi` are introduced which serve as a replacement for `chain_transaction`. With this, it should be also quite straight-forward to change the larger related test `mempool_packages.py` to use MiniWallet.

events.body:
Thanks again for the valuable feedback @MarcoFalke! Force-pushed with the following suggested changes:
- removed the assertion for non-empty UTXO list (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24637#discussion_r832217228)
- renamed helper method and split it up into `create_self_transfer_multi`/`send_self_transfer_multi` for the symmetry with existing helpers (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24637#discussion_r832218529 and https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24637#discussion_r832220737)

The PR description was also adapted accordingly.

events.message:
test: use MiniWallet for mempool_package_onemore.py

This test can now be run even with the Bitcoin Core wallet disabled.

events.body:
Force-pushed again with the following changes:
- all parameters for the newly introduced methods `{create,send}_self_transfer_multi` methods must be passed as keyword arguments now (to be consistent with `{create,self}_transfer` methods)
- `send_self_transfer_multi` returns a dictionary with several informations (txid, tx serialized as hex, tx as CTransaction instance, list of new UTXOs)
- introduced small helper `chain_tx` in the test in order to avoid repeatedly passing `from_node` arguments and being able to pass utxos ~~and num_outputs~~ as positional arguments; returns new UTXOs
- `getrawtransaction` RPC at the end of the test is not needed anymore, since we can directly access the `tx` field from the result dictionary

I think it only spends the first found (random) output

comments.body: Maybe it would be better to get rid of this and put the burden of coin selection on the caller? This would also allow the caller to decide whether the inputs are marked as spent or not if the call fails. (Other methods here also mark them as spent by default, even on failure)

+    def chain_tx(self, node, parent_txids, num_outputs=1, fee_per_output=1000):
+        """
+        Build and send a transaction that spends the given inputs and creates a
comments.body: Yes, I agree. Reworked the helper to accept and return UTXOs rather than txids now (i.e. caller has to do coin selection), which makes the test even shorter.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -188,6 +188,35 @@ def send_to(self, *, from_node, scriptPubKey, amount, fee=1000):
         txid = self.sendrawtransaction(from_node=from_node, tx_hex=tx.serialize().hex())
         return txid, 1
 
+    def chain_tx(self, node, utxos, num_outputs=1, fee_per_output=1000):
+        """
+        Build and send a transaction that spends the given UTXOs and creates a
+        certain number of outputs with equal amounts.
+
+        Returns a list of newly created UTXOs, ordered by vout index.
+        """
+        # create simple tx template (1 input, 1 output)
+        assert_greater_than_or_equal(len(utxos), 1)
comments.body: nit: Is this needed? The next line will assert even without this, but I can see the reason for a slightly better error message.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -188,6 +188,35 @@ def send_to(self, *, from_node, scriptPubKey, amount, fee=1000):
         txid = self.sendrawtransaction(from_node=from_node, tx_hex=tx.serialize().hex())
         return txid, 1
 
+    def chain_tx(self, node, utxos, num_outputs=1, fee_per_output=1000):
+        """
+        Build and send a transaction that spends the given UTXOs and creates a
+        certain number of outputs with equal amounts.
+
+        Returns a list of newly created UTXOs, ordered by vout index.
+        """
+        # create simple tx template (1 input, 1 output)
+        assert_greater_than_or_equal(len(utxos), 1)
+        tx = self.create_self_transfer(fee_rate=0, from_node=node, utxo_to_spend=utxos[0], mempool_valid=False)['tx']
+
+        # duplicate inputs, witnesses and outputs
+        tx.vin = [deepcopy(tx.vin[0]) for _ in range(len(utxos))]
+        tx.wit.vtxinwit = [deepcopy(tx.wit.vtxinwit[0]) for _ in range(len(utxos))]
+        tx.vout = [deepcopy(tx.vout[0]) for _ in range(num_outputs)]
+
+        # adapt input prevouts
+        for i, utxo in enumerate(utxos):
+            tx.vin[i] = CTxIn(COutPoint(int(utxo['txid'], 16), utxo['vout']))
+
+        # adapt output amounts (use fixed fee per output)
+        inputs_value_total = sum([int(COIN * utxo['value']) for utxo in utxos])
+        outputs_value_total = inputs_value_total - fee_per_output * num_outputs
+        for i in range(num_outputs):
+            tx.vout[i].nValue = outputs_value_total // num_outputs
comments.body: nit: Maybe wrap all of this into a `create_self_transfer_multi` helper for symmetry with the existing helpers?

nit: Maybe return a dict similar to `send_self_transfer`?

```suggestion
        return {"new_utxo":[self.get_utxo(txid=txid, vout=vout) for vout in range(len(tx.vout))], "tx": tx}
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -188,6 +188,46 @@ def send_to(self, *, from_node, scriptPubKey, amount, fee=1000):
         txid = self.sendrawtransaction(from_node=from_node, tx_hex=tx.serialize().hex())
         return txid, 1
 
+    def send_self_transfer_multi(self, **kwargs):
+        """
+        Create and send a transaction that spends the given UTXOs and creates a
+        certain number of outputs with equal amounts.
+
+        Returns a dictionary with
+            - txid
+            - serialized transaction in hex format
+            - transaction as CTransaction instance
+            - list of newly created UTXOs, ordered by vout index
+        """
+        tx = self.create_self_transfer_multi(**kwargs)
+        txid = self.sendrawtransaction(from_node=kwargs['from_node'], tx_hex=tx.serialize().hex())
+        return {'new_utxos': [self.get_utxo(txid=txid, vout=vout) for vout in range(len(tx.vout))],
+                'txid': txid, 'hex': tx.serialize().hex(), 'tx': tx}
+
+    def create_self_transfer_multi(self, *, from_node, utxos_to_spend, num_outputs=1, fee_per_output=1000):
+        """
+        Create and return a transaction that spends the given UTXOs and creates a
+        certain number of outputs with equal amounts.
+        """
+        # create simple tx template (1 input, 1 output)
+        tx = self.create_self_transfer(fee_rate=0, from_node=from_node, utxo_to_spend=utxos_to_spend[0], mempool_valid=False)['tx']
+
+        # duplicate inputs, witnesses and outputs
+        tx.vin = [deepcopy(tx.vin[0]) for _ in range(len(utxos_to_spend))]
+        tx.wit.vtxinwit = [deepcopy(tx.wit.vtxinwit[0]) for _ in range(len(utxos_to_spend))]
+        tx.vout = [deepcopy(tx.vout[0]) for _ in range(num_outputs)]
+
+        # adapt input prevouts
+        for i, utxo in enumerate(utxos_to_spend):
+            tx.vin[i] = CTxIn(COutPoint(int(utxo['txid'], 16), utxo['vout']))
+
+        # adapt output amounts (use fixed fee per output)
+        inputs_value_total = sum([int(COIN * utxo['value']) for utxo in utxos_to_spend])
+        outputs_value_total = inputs_value_total - fee_per_output * num_outputs
+        for i in range(num_outputs):
+            tx.vout[i].nValue = outputs_value_total // num_outputs
comments.body:
nit: Haven't tried, but this might be possible to write shorter

```suggestion
        for o in tx.vout:
            o.nValue = outputs_value_total // num_outputs
```

         return txid, 1

+                'txid': txid, 'hex': tx.serialize().hex(), 'tx': tx}

+        tx.vin = [deepcopy(tx.vin[0]) for _ in range(len(utxos_to_spend))]

+        inputs_value_total = sum([int(COIN * utxo['value']) for utxo in utxos_to_spend])
+        outputs_value_total = inputs_value_total - fee_per_output * num_outputs

+            tx.vout[i].nValue = outputs_value_total // num_outputs
